intro: Sphondylococca malabarica, commonly known as the Malabar starfruit, is a flowering plant native to the Indian subcontinent. It belongs to the family Lythraceae and is characterized by its striking, star-shaped flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant produces small, edible fruits that are typically yellow or orange when ripe. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing in moist, well-drained soils. Due to its ornamental value and unique fruit, it is cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
